definition:
an act or instance of passing through the air by the use of wings                                      
             
             the flight of a bee

the ability to fly                                      
             
             flight is natural to birds

a passing through the air or through space outside the earth's atmosphere                                      
             
             flight of an arrow
the distance covered in such a flight
swift movement

a trip made by or in an airplane or spacecraft                                      
             
             a transatlantic flight

a scheduled airplane trip                                      
             
             Our flight is at noon.

the airplane that is making a trip                                      
             
             They boarded flight 109.

a group of similar beings or objects flying through the air together                                      
             
             a flight of geese

a number of competitors (as in a sport) grouped together on the basis of demonstrated skill or ability or for purposes of elimination contests prior to a final test                                      
             
             At a meet, shot putters and discus throwers are often separated into flights.

a selection of alcoholic drinks (such as wines, beers, or whiskeys) for tasting as a group                                      
             
             Most of the 20 people attending the tasting were German wine collectors and they seemed almost always to prefer the most powerful wine in each flight.

a brilliant, imaginative, or unrestrained exercise or display                                      
             
             a flight of fancy

a continuous series of stairs from one landing or floor to another                                      
             
             Her apartment is four flights up.
a series (as of terraces or conveyors) resembling a flight of stairs
a unit of the U.S. Air Force below a squadron
flush

to rise, settle, or fly in a flock                                      
             
             geese flighting on the marsh
an act or instance of running away

an act of passing through the air by the use of wings                                      
             
             the flight of a bee

a passing through the air or space                                      
             
             a balloon flight

a trip by an airplane or spacecraft                                      
             
             a flight to Chicago

a group of similar things flying through the air together                                      
             
             a flight of ducks

an extraordinary display                                      
             
             a flight of imagination
a series of stairs from one level or floor to the next
the act of running away
in: the flight of a bee
flight is natural to birds
flight of an arrow
the flight of a rocket to the moon
a transatlantic flight

a flight of fancy
Her apartment is four flights up.
geese flighting on the marsh
a balloon flight
the flight of a space shuttle
a flight to Chicago
a flight to Mars
a flight of ducks
a flight of imagination

definition: a journey through air or space in a vehicle such as a plane
belonging to or connected with a flight
a movement through the air by a bird or object
a group of birds flying together
the act or process of moving through the air, or the ability to move through the air
the act of running away or of trying to escape from someone or something
a set of stairs going from one level to another
in: My flight has been delayed.
flight to/from: The flight from New York to Heathrow took about 8 hours.
on a flight: I need to be on the next flight out of here.
the airline’s flight schedule
a flight ban after midnight
Pigeons make flights of over 10,000 miles.
Several factors control the ball’s flight.
We saw a flight of geese heading south.
What was the direction of flight when the plane crashed?
the evolutionary advantages of developing flight
in flight: Swallows have a very distinctive shape in flight.
The refugees made a desperate flight to freedom.
The toilets are two flights up.
flight of stairs/steps: A flight of stone steps leads down to the courtyard.
flight of fancy/imagination
put someone to flight
take flight

definition: a journey in an aircraft:
an aircraft that is making a particular journey:
an occasion when something flies or moves through the air:
a group of birds, aircraft, etc. flying together:
(an act or example of) escape, running away, or avoiding something:
to defeat someone and force them to run away
(of a bird or an aircraft) to leave the ground and begin to fly:
to run away or leave a place:
a set of steps or stairs, usually between two floors of a building:
a number of different types of wine, beer, etc. for tasting:
an aircraft trip, or the occasion of being a passenger in an aircraft:
Flight is also the act or process of flying:
escape from a particular situation, or the act of leaving:
a set of stairs connecting one floor and the next in a building or other structure:
a situation in which people or goods move quickly away from a place to escape a bad situation:
people who are at the highest level in a job or business activity:
companies whose shares are worth the most money:
